intro: Webera lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf webera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Webera lanceolata is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
